subject: Re: Exception handling by junit
msgSnippet: That s odd:  It looks to me like Class.forName is throwing a java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError exception, instead of the expected
messageBody:
That's odd: It looks to me like 'Class.forName' is throwing
a 'java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError' exception, instead of the
expected 'java.lang.ClassNotFoundException'. Try catching
NoClassDefFoundError (too); maybe that will fix it.

--- "A.J. Bonnema" <abonnema@x> wrote:
> ------------- ---------------- ---------------
> Testcase: testOpenCloseDb(tierra.dbutils.DbAccessTest): Caused
an ERROR
> javax/resource/ResourceException
> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/resource/ResourceException
> at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
> at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:164)
> at tierra.dbutils.DbAccessDriverList.register
(DbAccessDriverList.java:80)
> at tierra.dbutils.DbAccessDriverList.<init>
(DbAccessDriverList.java:73)
> at tierra.dbutils.DbAccessDriverList.getInstance
(DbAccessDriverList.java:53)
> at tierra.dbutils.DbAccess.<clinit>(DbAccess.java:55)
> at tierra.dbutils.DbAccessTest.testOpenCloseDb
(DbAccessTest.java:74)
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native
Method)
> [...]
